title: How do get a clear face I mean no acne, no pimples, no marks naturally? - Quora

response.answer_text: I just want to say to be careful with the recommendations you read here. I also wanted to get clear skin and thought that natural remedies were the way to go. For years I used things like a tea tree lotion, rose water toner, and a Lush face soap including a lot of herbs (including tea tree and rose) and my face was always breaking out. I thought to myself, wow, my skin is awful—good thing I have these nice products or it might be even worse! Well, I’m allergic to tea tree and rose. Two VERY common ingredients touted as natural solutions to skin problems. If I use anything with either of these ingredients I break out like crazy. It took me until I was about 23 to figure it out! So don’t assume that everything that’s “natural” will be good for you. To answer your question though, here are some things that HAVE worked for me (although that doesn’t mean they’ll work for you): honey and cinnamon as a face mask, green tea or chamomile tea as a toner, and witch hazel as a toner. Another great option is oil cleansing. Basically, you take a mixture of oils and massage them into your skin for about two minutes. Then take a hot washcloth and drape it over your face to soften the oils, before very gently rubbing them off. (You can also use something besides a washcloth that’s designed to be gentler on your skin.) I did this for about two years with a mixture of castor oil, jojoba oil and a little tamuanu oil. Jojoba oil is moisturizing and castor oil is drying, so you have to use both and adjust the ratio to find out what works for you. I originally did half and half but noticed that my skin was too oily so I upped the castor, and that worked perfectly. Tamuanu oil is very expensive but very good for acne and you only need a few drops. If you like you can try a different “acne-fighting” oil such as sea buckthorn or tea tree (if you’re lucky enough to not be allergic!). Oil cleansing can make your skin break out at first before you adjust, but even during the “adjustment” period I could feel that my skin was loving all the rich nutrients and feeling softer and healthier. Many people like to “double cleanse” by using oils first and then using a more standard (gentle!) cleanser or micellar water to make sure all the oils are gone. I never bothered with that but if you have a very good cleanser you want to use, that might be a good thing to do! By the way, jojoba oil also makes a great body lotion after a shower and it’s good for your hair as well. It absorbs well and won’t feel greasy. I always keep a bottle around the house.

Acne can be caused by a slew of things such as diet, hormones, medications and/or dirty/oily skin. My profile photo is a few years old, when I was 17. You can see that my face was clear although it only shows half but it's the same on the other side. I wasnt really one to believe that all of this can go into Acne other than dirty and or oily pores. I get asked alot, even recently, what do I do to keep my face so clear. I always laugh because it was never something special, it was just always soap & water. I've been using Ivory Bar Soap since I was a kid and wash my face twice a day-- in the morning when I awake & right before I go to bed. Sometimes I can feel my face being oily and it results in me washing my face more than twice. Summer time, I washed it more due to all of the sweating. My diet was never good (I drink pop every day), I was on medication as a teenager due to depression and was under a lot of stress. But because I washed my face every day, I was fine. Everyone's body of course is different. My sister has super oily skin. Her only reason for having a face full of acne. She would try to use these advertised acne treatments on her face (Proactive, etc) but I remember a while ago reading somewhere that alot of these products actually causes acne to reappear so that you can continue buying their product. (Alot of chapstick companies are this way as well). I told her to just wash her face daily with soap & water. Shes been doing this for the past 2 years and it has cleared up significantly. The problem though when she washes her face is that her skin becomes super dry which means alot of healthy oil was being washed away as well. I recommended to her to buy a bottle of Aqauphor. It's a type of petroleum for severe dry skin but isnt as oily as vaseline. So when her face gets dry to the point her skin is flaking, I told her to just put a dab of Aqauphor in each quadrant of her face-- L/R Cheek, L/R Forehead and a dab on nose. SO LONG STORY SHORT, GET A BAR OF IVORY AND JUST WASH YOUR FACE 2X DAILY… ALSO, make sure your pillow/pillowcase is clean.

Hi Friend, Acne / pimples is a most common skin condition and almost 85% of people get it at some point in their lives. Acne occurs when the skin pores are clogged by dead skin cells. Excess sebum or oil in the skin and bacterial infection makes it worse causing pimples, puss, blackheads and whiteheads.  All of our pores contain a hair follicle and a sebaceous gland, which produces sebum, our skin’s natural oil. The body is constantly regenerating and shedding dead cells, but when those dead skin cells get trapped within the sebum of our skin, they combine to create noninflammatory acne. These are those black and white bumps on your skin — otherwise known as blackheads and whiteheads. If bacteria is present on the skin, it can combine with the dead cells and oil and cause an infection, otherwise known as inflammatory acne. Blackheads  Whiteheads  Papule Acne (P. Acne)  How to treat acne faster and forever? It is very difficult to treat acne permanently, but however, you can still control it and prevent frequent attacks. Acne medications work by reducing oil production, speeding up skin cell turnover, fighting bacterial infection or reducing inflammation — which helps prevent scarring. The doctor might prescribe ointments or creams containing one or a combination of retinoids, antibiotics, salicylic acid, azelaic acid or dapsone. Retinoids These come as creams, gels and lotions. Retinoid drugs are derived from vitamin A. It works by preventing plugging of the hair follicles.Antibiotics. These work by killing excess skin bacteria and reducing redness. Examples include clindamycin with benzoyl peroxide (Benzaclin, Duac, Acanya) and erythromycin with benzoyl peroxide (Benzamycin). Topical antibiotics alone aren't recommended.Salicylic acid and azelaic acid. Azelaic acid is a naturally occurring acid found in whole-grain cereals and animal products. It has antibacterial properties. Salicylic acid may help prevent plugged hair follicles and is available as both wash-off and leave-on products. Studies showing its effectiveness are limited.Dapsone. Dapsone (Aczone) Lower doses can treat inflammatory acne, especially in adults. Side effects include redness and dryness.Natural DIY methods? If you are looking for DIY remedies or natural remedies to treat the acne, below one has the best natural remedies that actually help to treat acne and to prevent re-occurrences by addressing the underlying cause  If you are using them or not, these natural remedies will help in effectively treating acne and to reduce the occurrences. 1. Tea tree oil: In a bowl take 2 table spoon of fresh water. Add 2 drops of tea tree oil to this. Mix the contents. Now with the help of cotton, apply this all over the face or affected area. Leave it on for 15 minutes. And wash away with fresh water. Do it every day. The anti-bacterial properties of tea tree oil help in quickly treating acne. Try to use face wash or body wash made of Tea tree oil.  2. Honey and Cinnamon mask: Take 1 table spoon of Honey into a bowl. Add ½ tea spoon of Cinnamon powder. Mix it well, apply it gently to face. Leave it on for 10 mins and gently wash away with fresh water. The antioxidant and antibacterial properties in them helps in treating pimples.  3. Witch hazel: Witch hazel is an astringent that can fight bacteria and prevent pimples. Witch hazel, may make your skin go dry. So, it should be used only by people with oily skin or normal skin. There are 3 steps in this. Apply your favorite cleanser and wash away with warm water.Take half teaspoon of witch hazel and dilute with 1 teaspoon of water. With the help of cotton, gently rub it on the face or affected area. Leave it on for 20 minutes and wash away with fresh warm water.Follow with moisturizer or apply aloevera gel 4. Apple cider vinegar: Buy apple cider vinegar with the mother. This also has 3 steps. Apply your favorite cleanser and wash away with warm water.Take ½ tea spoon of ACV into a bowl. To this add 1 tablespoon of water. Use cotton pad/ball to apply on skin. Leave it on for 20 minutes and wash away with fresh warm water.Follow with moisturizer or apply aloe vera gel. 5. Green tea mask: Prepare green tea usually and let it cool down.Take ½ tea spoon of turmeric into a bowl. To this add 1 table spoon of amla or gooseberry powder. Mix the green tea into. Mix the contents to form a fine paste. Apply this paste all over the face and wash away. Try these remedies and enjoy the benefits of reduced acne and pimples and clearer skin. These will effectively help in treating and preventing re occurrences.

First and most important thing to have a clear face is to clean it every day irrespective of whether you are using make up or not. One of the natural possibilities is to use oil based cleaning method. As the name suggests it is based on vegetable oils. This technique is even known back in ancient days.  In order for this method to work you need to pick an oil based on your skin type (not every oil is suitable for every skin). Here is a list which shows different types of oils: LOW possibility for clogged pores - argan, castor, hemp, grape seed, mango, pomegranate seed, rosehip oils and shea butterMEDIUM possibility for clogged pores - almond, apricot, avocado, evening primrose, hazelnut, olive, peach, sesame oilsHIGH possibility for clogged pores - cocoa butter, coconut butter, linseed, palm butter, wheat germThe usage of non gentle cosmetic products every day can harm your skin and make it dry or too oily. How this method works - pick oils based on your skin type and rub it gently into your skin. What will happen is that the oils will dissolve the impurities leaving it nourished and soft. After that remove the oils with wet warm cloth.  Other possibility for natural cleaning is to use clay. Here are different types which you should pick based on your skin type Green - this clay is suitable for oily skin. It regulates the fat secretion and naturally matts the skinWhite - it is ideal for sensitive skin. It can be even used on babies and children and is perfect for every skin type.Red - can be used on moderate skin and has revitalizing propertiesYellow - suitable for aged skin, has lifting effectBlue - known for its hydrating properties is perfect for mixed to dry skinGray - ideal for very dry skin, makes the skin lively and elasticIt can be used as a cleaner mixed with rose water or as a mask, but remember - leave it on the skin not more than 10 min.

Usually to answer this kind of question, people start mentioning skincare products such as serums, lotions, and cleansers. Truth is that the process to obtain a healthy and beautiful skin starts from within (even though it sounds cliché). From within means the food we eat, but also our habits play a huge role. When I say habits I mean applying sunscreen for long sun exposures and avoid alcohol and cigarettes. One of the best thing you can do to purify your skin is to do high intensity workouts and sweat. Sweating is nothing to be afraid of. However, excessive sweating can make the skin break out, especially if the person is acne-prone. Use a gentle cleanser free from alcohol, fragrance and harsh surfactants (for example a micellar water). Once your skin is all fresh and shiny again, it’s the best time to apply skincare products. In fact, the blood circulation is still increased from the previous workout putting your skin in a state where it is particularly receptive for treatments such as serums and moisturizers. Exercise is also great for your skin. This is mainly due to the fact that the effort and heat generated increases blood circulation and oxygen supply to the skin, which is clearly visible in reddening of the skin during exercise. More oxygen and nutrients in the skin also mean improved cell growth, which is reflected in an increased renewal rate of the cells. You will look younger with regular training! Furthermore, the increased blood circulation supports the removal of dead skin cells and free radicals. However, I need to add that if you are struggling with acne, unfortunately living healthy is probably not going to solve your problem. Acne has hormonal causes; you need to consult an experienced dermatologist in order to find a solution. I’m a cosmetic chemist…I will never tell you skincare products don’t work; however, true beautiful skin comes from sacrifice and discipline like anything else worth pursuing. If you still would like to know which kind of skincare products you should buy on top of all this you can read this article I wrote on how to recognize good quality skincare: How to choose the best skin care products Hope this helps!

Getting clear skin requires following certain things daily.Achieving great skin does not happen in over night.Caring your skin sporadically does not result you clear skin. Along with care,you have to take care of your diet also. Follow Cleansing,toning,moisturising routine daily twice. Always apply sunscreen before step out of your home.For the evening rituals, you can remove dirt by using glycerine and then apply almond or any oil of your choice over your face.Then use your face wash to completely remove the dirt.Once or twice in a week use natural scrubber like sugar with honey or oats with curd.Then apply rose water or any toner.As a final step in the ritual, you can apply any moisturiser or LactoCalamine lotion as well. If you have pimples then apply tea tree oil overnight or wipe it off after 3 hours.If you have dark circles then apply Vitamin E oil or Almond oil around your eyes overnight to wipe it off before you hit the sack.Vitamin E oil removes dark spots as well.These are Spot treatments. Check out this post as well Kalaivani Velusamy's answer to How do I remove pimples and dark spots overnight? Based on your skin problem just seal your skin with the specified treatment for that before closing your evening ritual. Have Green tea regularly,drink lot of water,eat lot of nuts and cut down Junk/white sugar/Salt/processed food. Thanks for A2A by Prajwal and Garima.

I have answered something like this on another question but here it goes: How to treat any types of pimple, from normal zits to cystic monsters kind. If you have normal clear skin and suddenly a pimple shows up, or you can somehow tell a pimple is on its way to make its debut (be it from redness or you could feel a slight pain/bumps), you should not worry. Go to your kitchen, open your freezer, take an ice cube, and rub it for as long as you can on your (soon) pimple. I dont have problem with rubbing it directly on my skin because i am used of its coldness but if you are new consider on putting towel paper or tissue as a barrier between ice and skin. Now, if you belong to the unluckiest like me, who struggles constantly and keep having a war with monstrous cystic good-for-nothing cystic acne; i got you covered! Keep in mind that, if your cystic acne comes from bacteria or any severe inflammation inside your body, YOU NEED ANTIBIOTICS. Visit your trusted dermatologist to help you. Okay, let’s continue with my trick for cystic acne. Exfoliate your face ONLY WITH CHEMICAL EXFOLIATOR. I highly recommend AHA and BHA from The Ordinary, but any other products your skin is suitable with is fine. As long as you are sure that the product exfoliate your skin thoroughly.Wash your face with normal water and favorite cleanser. For me i use cetaphil (gentle or oily types both products work great on me) and then i was my face again with warm tea (green tea/ black tea/ yellow tea, any will work just fine).Grab your ice cube and rub it on the concerned area. Do this as often as you can, at least in the morning and night.Benzoyl peroxide and clindamycin phosphate are your best weapon at night. DONT SPOT TREAT THEM. APPLY THEM EVERYWHERE TOPICALLY ON YOUR FACE IN JUST DECENT AMOUNT. Honestly, do this everyday whether you have pimple or not.Repeat the step 2 until 4 everyday. Step 1 only can be done twice a week.Five steps above will make your pimple ‘debunk’ itself. If you do this steps very early, you have a good chance that the pimple itself will never showed up and ended up becoming a small dry comedo then you can peel it off very easily. My skin now is almost flawless I hope I can help as much people as i can. I feel your pain. Everyone need to know this

Acne, pimples ,marks are all basically a result of combination of the internal and external environment. Out of all the skin types, oily skin is more prone to acne, blackheads and pimples. As someone who has been studying Ayurveda for past four years. here are the few things that I have tried over time some of which has drastically helped me in skin care. Aloevera - It is Ayurveda’s one of the most premium herbs for skin care. Known as Ghritkumari,use it in its natural form. A plant in your garden and your are set. Using the gel at night is your complete night care routine. It will make your skin glow like that of a kid. Consistency is the only key.I am not going to mention the numerous face packs that you can make at home. There are tonnes of DIYs that are already present on the internet. I just use mulatni mitti ( Fullers earth) with few drops of rose water and a tinge of turmeric. NOTHING BEATS THIS NATURAL REMEDY. Ty it out and you will see the results for yourself.Clean your face with milk every evening. Better brightening agent than most creams today.Go less spicy with diet to prevent breakouts. acne, pimples are basically due to the pitta nature of the skin ( a body type according to Ayurveda). To balance it out, add cool drinks(coconut water) to your diet.Wash off your face with cold water at least twice a day. It closes the pores and thus helps in preventing breakouts.Nothing topical will help if the internal environment is not favorable. Make sure to have lots of water and watery fruits to help balance out the body’s heat.Most important point, If you think the breakouts are more than normal and are painful do not hesitate and go see a dermatologist.

Drink water, lots of water. Dehydrated skin produces more oil to make up for water and excessive oil leads to acne. Water helps maintain your skin’s moisture level by keeping it hydrated and keeping pimples at bay. Drink at least 8 glasses of water for healthy glowing skin. Some tips to follow in your skincare regime: Cleanse your face well with a good mild oil control facewashExfoliate your skin with a good face scrub, preferably natural, at least one a weekDetox your skin with a good face mask at least once a weekKeep your skin hydrated, drink at least 8 glasses of water a daySpot treat your pimples with Tea tree oil diluted with water(patch test recommended)Invest in a good water-based or gel-based moisturizerDo not pop your pimples as they leave dark spotsThe main reasons for pimples include- Clogged pores: Usually skin pores get clogged due to exposure to dirt and pollution, excessive makeup products, not removing makeup properly and excessive oil production by the skin. Make sure to cover your face when stepping out, instead of using multiple layers of skin-enhancing products use one which does all the work, keep your face clean. Less water: Dehydrated skin produces more oil to make up for water and excessive oil leads to acne. Stress: Stress can trigger acne and can also make existing acne worse. Ever wondered why do pimples pop out at all the wrong timings, especially before an important event? This is mainly because of overthinking and unnecessary stress that we take. Keep yourself calm and worry less.

You can't get clear face by applying layers outside. The effect would be least 5% Clear skin doesn't come from outside, it always seems to be in the core (inside). Your core strength is your clear skin. In Tamil there is a proverb அகத்தின் அழகு முகத்தில் தெரியும். 1.The face is the irndex of the mind. Here we will understand term mind is skin. Ensure you are having good level of harmones and metabolism and how clean your system. Please join gym or do resistance workout at home with minimal dumbell workout. Concentrate on what you eat and avoid all kind of carbs. The carb includes all kind of fancy drinks, fruit juices,honey,white or brown sugar, all bakery items. 2.Proper Bowel movement, Not everyone has a bowel movement twice in a day but it should be regular everyday. You can have kefir curd or kefir milk to overcome constipation. Good bacteria available in the gut is responsible for your healthy system. It's a natural gift from your mother when you born by vaginal delivery. We are killing them everyday by artificial sweeteners and antibiotics. So start having vegetables and kefir milk. 3. Drink plenty of water (3L/day) and keep system hydrated. This is having a loop hole, when you start workout or going to gym, you will be forced to drink plenty of water automatically! 4. Clean your pillow covers properly and change them twice in a week, especially if you are having dandruff. You can Clear dandruff easily with the shampoos available in the market. Use a seperate towel for face and change them once in a week. 5. Wash your face with mild face wash thrice in a day. It's important to choose the facewash, very concentrated heavy face wash or soap will remove all natural oil from face and will dry out the deep skin layer. So wash face in the mornings, evenings, and nights and apply any face moisturizer of your choice in the night. Please follow above, you will get clear skin naturally and also skin complexion will improve. All the best!

If you have severe acne, there's really getting around accutane. That probably won't be enough though, seeing as as soon as you stop it, your acne might come back. So you need an appropriate skin care routine. As far as washing your face goes, you should use a gentle cleanser, without soap. Rinse thoroughly with cold water and dab your face dry with a clean cloth. Anti blemish creams usually dry out the skin and that's not a good thing. There are other creams that are more soothing and they worked better for me as long as I used them consistently - I personally used a cream called “Keracnyl PP” by Ducray and it worked wonder, not that I want to advertize any brand in particular. Then you need to be careful about what you eat. Shun dairy in favor of vegetable milks. You also need to eat your greens. Official guidelines vary from country to country, in France it’s said you ought to eat five servings a day. One great way to do this is to make smoothies with almond or soy milk - that’ll also keep your skin hydrated. Vegetable milk, good for everyone - LifeGate

Each of us knows them: those small, nasty redness and swellings on the face that always seem to appear when you really don't need them. Pimples. If they stay under the skin, they are blackheads, if they are visible, they are called whiteheads. How good that you can tackle the annoying skin blemishes. You can follow any of this Method that is following by stars for No Acne, No Pimple, No Marks. Tricks of the stars Supermodels in particular need perfect skin, it is their capital. You can find out which tricks they use for a flawless result here. Candice Swanepoel: The Victorias Secret model only uses natural beauty products. She removes her make-up with coconut oil every day and uses a mixture of tea tree oil and green tea to cleanse her skin. Miranda Kerr: She massages her skin twice a day with a cleaning brush, removing dead skin cells. She also regularly uses scrubs to care for her skin. Amber Valetta: Another supermodel with a penchant for natural products: Amber Valetta cleanses her skin with goat milk several times a week. The natural lactic acid is good for the skin and is simply dabbed on with a cotton pad and dried again with a towel. Kate Moss: Ice cream helps a lot after a long night. The model fills a sink with cucumber slices and ice, then pokes her face in it. So she looks fresh and fit again. Karolina Kurkova: Lemons are great for the skin, Karolina Kurkova knows that too. That's why she washes her face every morning with the juice of citrus fruit - this cleanses her skin and dries out pimples.

Hey !  Skin acne is a common problem now. Firstly, it may sound like a cliche, but, one needs to take care of their diet. Fresh fruits, vegetables and proper quantity of water are daily essentials for a healthier and problem free skin. Now, for acne, you should use Tea Tree Essential Oil. Highly recommended for all skin related issues. Blend it with Grapeseed Carrier Oil for better results. Proportion should be 4-5 drops of Tea Tree with 8-10 drops of Grapeseed. Hi. I used to have severe acne as well and it affected my self esteem in a very bad way. Though one day while I was at work, as I often would sweat a lot, I decided to start washing my hands, and then my face, (with soap and water), and then after drying my skin applying some lotion to it. I would repeat this whenever I began to sweat, (about 4–5 times a day as an initial way of keeping myself cool), and it eventually became my savior. After about a few weeks of doing this I noticed that my acne had completely disappeared and that my skin was silky smooth and completely clear. People began asking me what I did to get such clear and smooth skin though did not believe me when I shared this information with them. They were too convinced that I was using ProActive or something of that nature. It was a gigantic boost for my self esteem and I have never had acne again since then. This will definitely work for you as well and after you achieve the same results, I just ask that you share it with anyone else who may be in need of an answer to their acne.

To get completely clear skin with no marks is going to be hard. Marks come with age and sun exposure so you can prevent it, but you can’t get rid of them naturally. However, you can reduce the appearance of marks with different creams and topical treatments. You can also try to stop more appearing by using sun screen every day (even if it’s not sunny), drinking a lot of water, eating healthily, and keeping your face clean. For acne & pimples, you want to make sure you have a good skin care routine. Here is an example of a skincare routine which should slowly work to reduce acne/pimples (remember, there are no quick fixes): Wash your face with a gentle cleanserUse a chemical exfoliator with Alpha-Hydroxy Acids in (Luminositie (you can find them on Amazon I think) do a good AHA serum). Stay away from exfoliating scrubs like St Ives - they cause damage to the skin when you scrub your face with them and open you up to sun damage.Use direct acids (such as Salicylic) or a Niacinamide cream which are great for cell turnover, reducing the appearance of pores, and reducing sebum productionMoisturise! This is so important. Find one that suits your skin type (oily, dry, normal, combination). If you don’t moisturise your skin could react by creating more oil to make up for the fact it is dry.Getting rid of acne is not a quick thing, you need to spend time and energy and make lifestyle changes if you want to reduce the chances of it long-term. I hope this helps!

If you need to clear pimple marks from your face follow these tips- Sugar scrub to erase pimple marks. Take three table spoons of sugar, 1 tablespoon of milk powder and one tablespoon of honey, mix them together and scrub this mixture over the face for few minutes and rinse it off after 15 minutesEgg white to lighten pimple marks.Take a fresh egg and break the egg, separate the egg white from the egg yolk. Apply this egg white on the pimple marks. After 10-15 minutes, wash off with cold water.Baking Soda for lightening pimple scars.Take 1 teaspoon of baking soda. Mix few drops of water with it and apply this mixture on the pimple marks.Lemon to treat pimple spots.Squeeze half a lemon and mix the juice with double the amount of glycerin. Now dab this mixture on the skin and leave on. Wash off with water after 10 minutes.

I’ve never had severe acne, but I’ve had the occasional outbreak of hormonal acne. What helped me was a gel cleanser by Simple (that stuff works so well, I’m currently on my third container), a moisturizer (the one I use is by Derma E), and NO walnut scrubs/exfoliators. Those will make you break out more, cause microtearing on your face, and make your acne scars worse. I quit using mine about 4 months ago, and my skin has never looked better. Drink plenty of water (I add some turmeric extract to mine. Turmeric is a natural anti-inflammatory and you can barely taste it when added to a drink). You can also take vitamins (I take collagen occasionally, vitamin E, vitamin C, and iron) and supplements like turmeric capsules. These are all things that I do every day (minus the supplements, those I do several times a week) and the skincare can be found at just about any drugstore (or grocery store like Giant and Food Lion). Remember to do these things consistently. I hope this helps you!

I swear by aloe vera gel. If you decide to try this, make sure you're getting the highest amount of aloe to other ingredients. My recommended is at LEAST 97%, but 99% works best. If you can get hold of the plant, even better. However, unless you buy ready plant strips, you'll have to wait a while until the plant actually grows. It is healing, soothing and completely natural. You can use it as a mask, use as a moisturiser (if you have dry skin I would recommend topping it off with your usual moisturiser as it will dry out your skin) or as a spot/mark treatment. The reason it will be particularly good for acne is because it is antiseptic and anti-inflammatory. I started having cystic acne at the age of 19 and it took me forever to find a replacement for my benzoyl peroxide. I didn't want to use chemicals or medications on my face to aggravate it more. After a couple of days of using the gel, my inflamed acne was almost gone. It took the marks about 2 weeks to a month to completely fade depending on the size, degree of inflammation and whether or not I was picking it (one of my worst habits, please don't do this). Give it a try!

I have tried so many methods and products to get rid of my acne, a very useful method I found is changing your cotton pillowcase to a silk pillowcase. it's hypoallergenic, breathable, and moisture-wicking. On top of that, it also minimizes the appearance of sleep creases upon waking up that have been linked by research to premature wrinkle-formation. In fact, a study by the Department of Dermatology in Medical University (Austria) found that a special type of silk textiles had positive results on back acne after wearing a silk shirt for six weeks. Although the silk fabric used for pillowcases is not exactly the same as these, we can infer from the study that silk is a better fabric than cotton when it comes to sensitive and acne-prone skin. I purchased my silk pillowcase on THXSILK website and it only cost me $13 and it really worth the price! My acne has decreased a lot and the silk texture is much more comfortable than cotton.

We face many kinds of facial problems as we grow older especially adolescence period. Acne occurs when oil glands attached to the hair follicles are stimulated at the time of puberty or due to other hormonal changes. Here are some few tips on how to clean the skin: Put fresh lemon juice into a bowl. Dilute the juice with a little amount of water if your skin is too sensitive. Some cases, you don't need water so better use the normal juice. Use a cotton ball, dab the fresh lemon juice over the acne scars and pimple marks. Keep your face clean. Whether or not you have acne, it's important to wash your face twice daily to remove dirt, dead skin cells, and extra oil from your skin's surface. However, if symptoms persist, I strongly recommend to see an expert. That would be the best option!

Exfoliation is probably the fastest way for dimensioning scars. You can use chemical peeling for better results. There are some natural chemical peelers like sugar (glycolic acid), and citrus fruits (citric acid). One face mask for exfoliating and lightening skin tone that I love is Yogurt and lemon juice face mask. Add few drops of freshly squeezed lemon juice and mix with 3 tablespoons of plain yogurt, apply to your face and leave on for 10-15 minutes before you scrub gently. Then wash with warm water and apply a moisturizer. You will have to use such face mask for a while before you see visible results. Good luck!

Buy a Massager. Face massagers can be found in a abubdance, online and offline. Use a good foaming and deep clean facewash and put it all over your face. Once your skin gets healthy. Make it 5 mins of massage every day and it'll maintain. After the massage, what I do was put a thin layer of toothpaste(the white one, not the gel ones) around my nose borders(where I get most of the oil secretion) or put anti bacterial talc on my face lightly and go to bed.

Aloe vera gel and sandalwood are 2 products, that will help calm the breakouts and give a cooling sensation on the skin. If used regularly you can see results within a month. Be sure to use organic products ( aloe vera extract directly from the plant or a product from the market which has 70% or more aloe content and for sandal wood, it is better to buy the sandal wood stick from a ayurvedic store rather than buying the powder form). After the breakouts are gone, you might still be left with scars ( Acne scars) you can continue using chandan and aloe vera gel but I would advise you to include BIO OIL in your skin care routine ( use aloe in the morning and bio oil ant night, that way you can get the goodness from both products ). Having said that, it is also important to have good eating habits (NO OILY FOOD), drink plenty of water ( minimum of 4 Liters a day! ) and of course, a good nights sleep (as stress is often the cause of pimples on forehead)! EDIT : TEA TREE oil can be used on the pimple to dry it out, but this is not advised in the winter season since the skin is already dry (and sometimes flaky too) in this season!
